title: Ganges River
description: A 2,525 km river in India and Bangladesh, sacred in Hinduism and vital for agriculture.

title: Yangtze River
description: Asia's longest river (6,300 km) flowing through China, home to the Three Gorges Dam.

title: Mekong River
description: Flows through six Asian countries, supporting fishing, rice farming, and biodiversity.

title: Nile River
description: World's longest river (6,650 km) running through 11 African countries into the Mediterranean.

title: Amazon River
description: South America's largest river by discharge, surrounded by vast rainforest ecosystems.

title: Mount Everest
description: Highest mountain on Earth (8,848 m) on the Nepal–China border, part of the Himalayas.

title: Sahara Desert
description: Largest hot desert in the world, spanning over 9 million km² in North Africa.

title: Great Wall of China
description: 21,000 km ancient fortification protecting China's northern borders.

title: Sydney Opera House
description: Iconic UNESCO World Heritage site in Australia, famous for its sail-shaped design.

title: Eiffel Tower
description: Paris landmark built in 1889, standing 324 m tall and visited by millions annually.

title: Victoria Falls
description: Waterfall on the Zambezi River at the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe, 'Smoke that Thunders'.

title: Mount Kilimanjaro
description: Africa's highest peak (5,895 m) in Tanzania, a dormant volcano with glacier caps.

title: Statue of Liberty
description: Gift from France to the USA in 1886, symbolizing freedom, located in New York Harbor.

title: Machu Picchu
description: 15th-century Inca citadel in Peru, set high in the Andes Mountains.

title: Antarctic Ice Sheet
description: Largest single mass of ice on Earth, covering about 98% of Antarctica.
